member.name: T:Variable.Core.IBoundedInfo
member.summary: Represents a bounded numeric value constrained by a minimum and maximum range. This interface is intended primarily for editor tooling and UI visualization.
member.remarks:
This interface is implemented by all bounded types in the GameVariable ecosystem, including BoundedFloat, BoundedInt, Timer, Cooldown, and similar constructs.
Implementations are expected to guarantee that the current value always lies within the inclusive range defined by and .
For logic operations like IsFull(), IsEmpty(), and GetRatio(), use the extension methods in .

member.name: T:Variable.Core.ICompletable
member.summary: Represents a time-based value that can be ticked and checked for completion. This interface unifies Timer (count-up) and Cooldown (count-down) behaviors.

remarks.para: Implementations of this interface represent temporal states that progress over time and eventually reach a completion state (Timer reaches Duration, Cooldown reaches 0).
For Timer: IsComplete returns true when Current >= Duration (counting UP).
For Cooldown: IsComplete returns true when Current <= 0 (counting DOWN).

member.name: P:Variable.Core.ICompletable.IsComplete
member.summary: Gets whether the temporal state has reached completion.
member.returns: true if the timer has completed or the cooldown is ready; otherwise, false.

member.name: F:Variable.Core.MathConstants.Tolerance
member.summary: The default tolerance for floating-point comparisons to handle precision errors. Used to snap values to min/max and determine equality. This value is used across all packages for consistency.
member.remarks: For most game scenarios, 0.001f (1/1000th) is sufficient. Override this value at runtime if your application requires different precision: - Higher precision: Use 0.0001f or smaller - Lower precision/performance: Use 0.01f - Large-scale values: Consider scaling tolerance proportionally
